program_overview.title: Complete College Mathematics Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: From Calculus to Cutting-Edge Mathematics - Master the Language of the Universe
program_overview.description:
This intensive 2-year program covers the entire undergraduate mathematics curriculum and beyond. Whether you're a college student, self-learner, professional seeking mathematical depth, or preparing for graduate studies, this masterclass transforms you into a mathematical thinker.

You'll master calculus, linear algebra, abstract algebra, real analysis, topology, and applied mathematics. Learn to write rigorous proofs, solve complex problems, use computational tools, and understand the deep connections between mathematical fields. By completion, you'll have the knowledge equivalent to a mathematics major from a top university.

learning_path.phase_1: Foundation (Months 1-6): Single Variable Calculus, Linear Algebra, Proof Writing
learning_path.phase_2: Core Mathematics (Months 7-12): Multivariable Calculus, ODEs, Discrete Math, Probability
learning_path.phase_3: Advanced Theory (Months 13-18): Real Analysis, Abstract Algebra, Topology, Complex Analysis
learning_path.phase_4: Specializations (Months 19-24): PDEs, Numerical Analysis, Optimization, Research Topics

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Mathematical Foundations (Months 1-6, Weeks 1-26)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build rock-solid foundations in calculus, linear algebra, and mathematical reasoning with proof writing.

week_1_2.title: Limits and Continuity
topics: Review of functions: domain, range, composition
Limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes
Continuity at a point and on intervals
week_1_2.practice: Complete 100 limit problems with epsilon-delta proofs

week_3_4.title: Differentiation
topics: Definition of derivative as a limit
Basic differentiation rules: power, constant, sum
Derivatives of exponential and logarithmic functions

week_5_6.title: Applications of Derivatives
week_5_6.practice: Solve 150 application problems with full solutions

week_7_8.title: Integration Fundamentals
topics: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part I
Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part II
Integration of exponential and logarithmic functions
projects: Volume calculator for solids of revolution

month_3_4.title: Months 3-4: Calculus II & Linear Algebra I

week_9_10.title: Advanced Integration Techniques
topics: Improper integrals Type I and II

week_11_12.title: Sequences and Series
topics: Comparison tests and limit comparison test
Alternating series test and error bounds
Power series and radius of convergence
week_11_12.practice: Analyze 100 series for convergence with proofs

week_13_14.title: Linear Algebra: Vectors and Matrices
topics: Row echelon form and reduced row echelon form

month_5_6.title: Months 5-6: Advanced Linear Algebra & Vector Calculus

week_20_21.title: Vector Spaces and Linear Transformations
topics: Coordinate systems and change of basis
Row space, column space, null space
Kernel and image of linear transformation

week_22_23.title: Multivariable Functions and Partial Derivatives
topics: The gradient vector and directional derivatives
The chain rule for multivariable functions

week_24_25.title: Optimization and Vector Fields
topics: Second derivative test for two variables

week_26.title: Phase 1 Capstone Project
topics: Integration of calculus and linear algebra
projects: Options: Population dynamics, Economic models, Engineering systems
Complete proof portfolio with 25 original proofs
week_26.assessment: Phase 1 Comprehensive Exam - Calculus and Linear Algebra

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Core Mathematics (Months 7-12, Weeks 27-52)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Master multivariable calculus, differential equations, discrete mathematics, and probability theory.

week_27_28.title: Double and Triple Integrals
topics: Center of mass and moments of inertia

week_33_34.title: Higher-Order Linear ODEs
topics: Repeated roots and reduction of order

week_35.title: Laplace Transforms
topics: Definition and existence of Laplace transform
Partial fraction decomposition for inverse transforms

week_40_41.title: Graph Theory
topics: Types of graphs: simple, directed, weighted

week_49_50.title: Statistical Inference
topics: Point estimation: MLE and method of moments
Type I and Type II errors

week_52.title: Phase 2 Capstone Project
topics: Integration of discrete and continuous mathematics
projects: MAJOR CAPSTONE: Applied Mathematics Research Project
Options: Machine learning algorithm, Cryptographic system, Statistical study
Graph theory application to real networks

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Advanced Pure Mathematics (Months 13-18, Weeks 53-78)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master real analysis, abstract algebra, topology, complex analysis, and advanced mathematical theory.

week_55_56.title: Limits and Continuity in R^n
topics: Sequences and series of real numbers
Continuity and uniform continuity on R

week_61.title: Sequences and Series of Functions
topics: Power series and radius of convergence

week_70.title: Module Theory
topics: Structure theorem for finitely generated modules over PID

week_78.title: Phase 3 Capstone Project
projects: Write expository paper on advanced topic
Create visualization tools for abstract concepts
Develop lecture series on chosen topic

phase_4_advanced_production.title: PHASE 4: Applied Mathematics & Research (Months 19-24, Weeks 79-104)
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Master PDEs, numerical analysis, optimization, mathematical modeling, and conduct original research.

week_104.title: Career Paths & Future Learning
week_104.assessment: FINAL COMPREHENSIVE EXAM - Complete undergraduate mathematics
